1.text: Choose which fruits to use in the bouquet.

2.text: Clean and trim your fruit so it’s ready to eat.

3.text: Cut your larger fruit into small, decorative pieces.

4.text: Skewer each piece of fruit through the center.

5.text: Dip some of your fruit pieces in chocolate.

6.text: Place the fruit skewers in a flipped colander.

7.text: Fill a vase with large cubes of floral foam.

8.text: Cover the floral foam with foil to protect the fruit.

9.text: Stick the skewers of fruit into the floral foam.

10.text: Arrange pieces of lettuce on the vase’s bottom.

11.text: Pick nice-smelling herbs to use in the bouquet.

12.text: Put herbs into a bouquet with your dominant hand.

13.text: Tie the stems together to keep them secure.

14.text: Rip off the blossom portion from the fake roses.

16.text: Take a piece of bacon and roll it to form a rose.

17.text: Stick two toothpicks in the bacon to hold it in place.

18.text: Put a metal rack over a pan lined with foil.

19.text: Place the bacon on the rack.

20.text: Slide the bacon into the oven for 45 minutes.

21.text: Remove the toothpicks from the bacon.

22.text: Stick the cooked bacon on top of the fake rose.

23.text: Position the bacon roses nicely in a vase.
